original_title: Sri Lanka to continue importing eggs from India
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Sri Lanka State Trading (General) Corporation has imported 155 million eggs from Indian farms approved by the Department of Animal Production and Health (DAPH).

The cabinet of ministers gave the nod to import another 18 million eggs before the year end, to keep prices down to fill a gap in domestic production, a statement by the government information department said.
“This will stabilise the price of eggs in the local market,” it said.

Sri Lanka’s chicken farms were closed and hatcheries killed layer parent stocks after the Consumer Affairs Authority, a state agency, slapped price controls on eggs at a time when feed prices rocketed in a currency collapse.
Sri Lanka had also restricted the import of maize, the key raw material for chicken feed through import taxes to give extra profits to maize farmers. (Colombo/Dec19/2023)
